comment: Took this class online for my degree. Only problem I had was that this course was alot of busy work with the group project and alot of time for typing an individual research paper. Easy A, so long as you keep up with deadlines you'll be ok.

Can be a bit condescending, especially if you don't talk in class much. Answer his questions and he's more likely to warm to you. Tests are challenging, 25 questions, study his lectures online. You give a presentation, and if you aren't prepared for it, he'll roast you in front of the class. Do the research for it and take it seriously. Made an A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tough Grader

comment: If you allow yourself to vibrate on his level, you will learn something profound, guaranteed. He is a well of knowledge. Best that you know your stuff and keep an open mind. If you're the "back of class" type, don't bother.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Makes you study excessively for a 25 question test with obscure questions. I love art, but his lectures are very dry. Have to learn the material through other student presentations. He is very rude to students presenting. Will interrupt, and talks down to students who participate in class discussion. 1/10. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Probably the worst professor or teacher I have ever had. He is rude and gives tons of information to study for a 25 question test  where you have to know small details. We spent half the semester presenting projects and had to rely on the work of our classmates to learn test material.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Straightforward class, 6 tests, but takes an average of best 5. Plus 2 options for extra credit. I averaged Bs, Cs, and Ds on the test but finished with a B in the class. Its doable, but very long lectures on very dry material. Might be interesting only if you care about art. Beware: he will roast you if you are not prepared during EC presentation

GO TO CLASS! He makes you work for your grade, but if you study your stuff you should pass. If you miss a class, make sure you know someone who takes good notes, you will need to know the little details from class. He genuinely cares about what the students learn, so he can come across as stern. He is quite funny once the the barrier is broken.

He is totally monotone, does not really care about the subject, and is horrible with feedback. He asked us for feedback, and as soon as anyone said anything he started arguing with them even if they were respectful. He kept changing the requirements for the presentations after sending out the rubric and after some students had already presented.

Pavel can be very rude at times especially if he doesn't agree with what you think about a piece of art. He feels like you're supposed to know as much as him. There are 3 test which are based off of his lectures. This class is difficult because you have to remember names of artist/art work, time periods, & where the art was originated. GO TO CLASS!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Your grade will be made up of 3-4 tests, one presentation (you will pick an artpiece), and class participation. He may sound a bit condescending at times, but that's only because he expects us to do our research and study well, and most of us are taking this because it's a gen ed requirement. BUT he knows his stuff and is willing to help.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This guy is rude, he will roast you in front of the whole class for asking a question and also knows more about art and what he's talking about than anyone else at KSU. Attendance is not mandatory, but all test material is from the lectures so just go to class.  You have to KNOW your presentation or he will make fun of you during it. serious

Make sure you are prepared for your presentation or he will roast you in front of everyone. Attendance- not required, he posts everything online but sometimes asks more detailed test questions. His class is super boring, but if you at least show up most of the time and study using the powerpoints on D2L before each test, you should pass.

Class is made up of 3 tests, presentation, in class ass., and museum ticket TEST- 25% of grade  EACH- made quizlets with the info for them, 25 multi-choice questions, easy if you study! PRESENTATION- HARD! Know your stuff, will be critical if you don't!!! -10% of grade **NEVER USED MY TEXTBOOK***

He is very rude, and will not consider anything you say to be valid. He is like talking to a rock wall. He's already made up his mind; he's right, you're wrong, end of story. The class is easy if you pay attention in class. Participation is not required and I would not recommend speaking in class because he will make you look stupid.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is EXTREMELY easy. Pavel is very intimidating and somewhat rude, but this is such an easy A. I made a 96 on all four tests without cheating, and it is super easy to cheat in this class. HAHA! You have four tests, a presentation (which is easy as long as you put effort into it), participation, and museum visit. Don't be afraid to take him

He is probably the rudest person I have ever met.  He never seems happy and always tries to tear the students down. During the presentation he interrupts and makes you feel stupid. I regret taking him so much. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!!!!!

Professor Pavel is a truly blunt man, but you can tell he's really passionate about art. He encourages discussion, and participation. I thought the exams were incredibly easy. They go over the basic art material covered in each class. Go to all the classes and really study the study guides. Don't be lazy and you'll do great.

By far the worst teacher at KSU. One of those teachers that just has to teach in order to do the things he wants. Only lecture.Tests are ridiculous, unless you are great at memorizing things don't take him. Very arrogant and thinks he knows everything. Don't answer questions in class because he will make you look stupid and have no problem doing so

DO NOT TAKE! Unless you are interested in art and can stand a rude professor that asks questions to make you look dumb then don't take him. His tests are powerpoint you get 30 sec per question and he doesn't go back. 3 tests and a presentation. Make sure you know EVERYTHING about your topic because he expects you to know it for a 2 min presentation

Interesting class however, the professor will ask for your opinion in class and then make you look like a fool after you answer. After two months of class no one asks questions or speaks up if asked to solely due to the professors normally negative and disrespectul response. Try to find a different instructor if possible.

I hope I never have to take this professor ever again. He has a monotones voice, very rude and obnoxious. He cuts people off during presentation and then chews them out in front of the entire class which is very rude. I was really interested in taking this class, but now I'm just ready for it to be over and never return again. Tragic.

I would never take this teacher again. He's mostly monotone in the lectures until he has someone up to do a volunteer presentation. Then he interrupts rudely and gets the student flustered by asking questions he didn't tell them to look up. I ended up walking out in the middle of a class and not returning because of how rude & condescending he is.

STUDY FOR THESE TESTS 25 questions there is no room for error. Presentations are fun if you follow instructions. Although the book isn't required you either need to attend lectures or read the chapter material.

Mr Pavel is a solid professor.  Textbook isnt necessary, take notes. Be in class when he reviews for the tests. With Art, we go over so much stuff but we are only tested on such a small percentage, which makes it difficult to study. Presentations can be hard because he may grill you in front of the class.

I tried to reach out to Mr. Pavel for help outside of class. After exchanging a few emails, he sat asaid a mere 10 minutes for me after one of his english classes, and managed to walk right past me and completely forgot about our scheduled "meeting". If you need help in this class, you need to look for it elsewhere.

The class itself seems fairly easy but the tests don't reflect the material that he focuses on in class. He requires one that you attend one art-related event on or off campus and there is a speech that is worth 10 percent of your grade. Don't take this class if you expect an easy A, he is not very willing to help with grades.

The class itself seems fairly easy but the tests don't reflect the material that he focuses on in class. He requires one that you attend one art-related event on or off campus and there is a speech that is worth 10 percent of your grade. Don't take this class if you expect an easy A, he is not very willing to help with grades.
Best teacher at Ksu He is so smart and will definitely help you when needed.Take him I really recommend Prof Pacel

I liked this class at first. I got an A on the first exam and after that it went downhill. He started giving us study guides that had nothing to do with the tests. Then he went from 50 questions tests to 25 questions tests. Miss more than 2 questions and you just dropped a letter grade. Easy if you study but boring, boring. He just lectures.
He is very condescending and has a smart-alec remark to anything that is said to him. I would not recommend this class to ANY ONE!

Dr. Pavel is willing to put forth the effort to help his students succeed. His tests are elementary and, unlike other Profs. he does not inflate ones grade - You get what you deserve. However, do not be afraid to try. Attaining "visual literacy" takes time and practice, and mistakes have to be made before one can learn.
Easy class, good professor. Too many required events

Professor Pavel is way passionate about art, and really knows his stuff! he's so kind, and willing to share his info. wants class participation. easy enough a, with little work. be warned that this is a class where you do need to participate, but you didn't come to college to slide by. take him if you love art and learning!

This class made me want to become an anthropologist. He was an extremely knowledgeable teacher and was by far one of the most interesting classes I've had so far. Yes, he expects a lot and a review would have been helpful but if you use common sense and listen to what he's saying you can easily get an A.

Would never recommend this class to anyone. The class seemed like it would be an awesome subject when i decided to take it,but the teaching methods were ridiculous. Speaking up in EVERY class, yes it is do-able... but why speak if you have nothing really to say about the subject? The tests,all strictly online- bottom line - waste of time.

Wouldn't recommend Pavel to ANYONE. You must speak in every class, which isn't hard, but don't take this class if you're shy. Only 3 grades: participation, midterm, final. Midterm was ok, but final was ridiculous & barely anyone passed it. Many people contacted the head of the dept. & dean about his grading. One of the worst professors I've had.

Class was very difficulty. Only two main test grades. Must speak during every class in order to receive participation points which were a major part of the grade. Tests were online, but difficult, because there was not a lot of time given, and the questions were very detailed. I took a lot of notes, studied, and yet I got a low grade.

Must speak during EVERY CLASS and must remember EVERY WORD HE SAYS (on powerpoint or not) in order to pass the final, which barely anyone did. Many students went to the dean about this teacher. I managed to make a decent grade in the class, but I would not recommend him to anyone.
Very Hard Class. He did not review for exams. Grades are two exams and participation.
